SYSTEM: Metodolog%C3%ADa-1-v1%28asun%29.pdf: Página 33
© A. Gómez Pérez, M.C. Suárez-Figueroa, B. Villazón
36
Ontological Engineering
Ontology Specification: Users
4
Intended Users
1. Candidate who is unemployed and searching for a job or 
searching another occupation for immediate or future purposes
2. Employer who needs more human resources.
3. Public or private employment search service which offers 
services to gather CVs or job postings and to prepare some 
data and statistics.
4. National and Local Governments which want to analyze the 
situation on the employment market in their countries and 
prepare documents on employment, social and educational 
policy.
5. European Commission and the governments of EU countries 
which want to analyze the statistics and prepare international 
agreements and documents on the employment, social and 
educational policy.
 Input: a set of ontological needs
 Objective: identifying the intended users
 Techniques: physical or virtual interviewers
 Output: a list with the intended users, which
will be included in the corresponding slot of the
OSRD template
speaker: SYSTEM
